intro: Cinchona condaminea var. pitayensis, commonly known as the Pitaya cinchona, is a species native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching structure and dark green, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, followed by oval, red berries containing elliptical seeds. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and historical use in traditional medicine. Its cultivation is often associated with its adaptability to high-altitude environments and its role in the production of quinine.
